children.subject: It's never too early to apply. A lot of positions will be marketed towards new grads, but for those that aren't, it wouldn't hurt to mention your desired start date. If the company isn't looking for candidates starting at that time, the worst that could happen is that they don't contact you.

history.content:
I'll be graduating in Spring 2021 and have started looking into full-time or contract data science jobs, but I was wondering when is too early to apply. All of the positions I've seen so far aren't marketed toward new grads, so is it still okay to apply now even though I wouldn't start working until May 2021?

I also don't have significant internship experience, so I don't even really know where to be looking for jobs beyond LinkedIn, Handshake, and career fairs. Does anyone have any advice to finding data science jobs (resources + timeline)? I've looked at some past threads but any new/relevant advice would be much appreciated!
history.subject: Applying to jobs as a new grad
